text: , also spelled as Shō-ō, was a after Kōan and before Einin. The period started in April 1288 and ended in August 1293.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2002). "Shō-ō" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 885. Jinnō Shōtōki. pp. 237-238. ==Events of the Shōō era== * 1288 (Shōō 1): The future Emperor Go-Fushimi was born.Deal, William. (2007). title: Shōō (Kamakura period)
